purpleculture_pinyin:

to stick; to paste; to post (e.g. on a blog); to keep close to; to fit snugly; to subsidize; allowance (e.g. money for food or housing); sticker; classifier for sticking plaster: strip
наклеить; вставить; публиковать (например, в блоге); держаться поближе; плотно прилегать; субсидировать; пособие (например, деньги на питание или жилье); наклейка; классификатор для наклеивания гипса: полоса

heisig_keyword: рекламировать афишу, post a bill | рекламировать афишу, выставить счет
heisig_chinese_memo: The fortune teller writes your fortune on a piece of paper and tells you to affix it to a shell with some paste and throw into the ocean for it to come true. Picture licking the back of the shell like a stamp and affixing it to the fortune.
heisig_constituent: affix, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, fortune-telling, magic wand, augury, mouth
heisig_story: The key word in this frame has do with posting bills to a billboard. In this case, the billboard is standing at the exit to a Chinese restaurant displaying the latest alternative to the tradition fortune-telling cookies. Look closely and you will see rows of leftover shells of clams with little slips of paper sticking out of them posted to the billboard.

koohiiStory1: Fortune teller writes your fortune on a piece of paper and tells you to affix it to a shell and throw into the ocean for it to come true. Picture licking the back of the shell like a stamp and affixing it to the fortune.
koohiiStory2: I gots a fix for your current bad luck: just pass some extra clams over to the fortune teller, and they will make sure you have a very bright fate instore.
jp_example_words: 貼る(はる): to stick, paste
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Your shellfish are worth a fortune because you decided to paste your fortune to the shellfish.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture all of your riches, your money, your jewels. They're all pasted directly onto all of your shellfish!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You're a little crazy, which is why you decided to use paste to paste your entire fortune to these shellfish, and as you paste each one you yell out, "Ha (は)!" Paste.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: "Ha ha!" Paste paste. "Ha ha ha!!" PASTE PASTE PASTE.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This shellfish likes to tell fortunes and shows his success to new customers by using paste to put up pictures of old ones on the wall since he has no fortune telling college degree to put up.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " bei " and " accounting ", the original meaning is pawn, that is, material money. "Shuowen Xinfu": "The quality is also from the shells. From the shells, the sound is accounted." "The Southern History·Cai Kuo Biography": "The people Yang Yuansun uses the maidservant to pick up Zhizhi paste and Tongli Huangquan to have children and pay for breastfeeding. "

" Paste " can mean compensation or subsidy. "Journey to the West" Chapter 35: "Hurry up and give it back to me, pay more money, I like to send the old grandson to get up, and spare you the old demon's life!"

" Post " also means to be close. "Water Margin" Chapter 74: "It turns out that Liangshanpo is next to Shouzhang County."

" Post " also means proper and appropriate. Song Mei Yaochen "Meeting of Ciyun and Master Changji Huaidian": "The words are all properly attached, and the karma is not overwhelming."

" Paste " also refers to sticking or posting. Tang Wen Tingyun "Bodhisattva Man": "The front and back mirrors of the flowers reflect each other. The new embroidered Luo Yu, double gold partridges."

" Paste " also refers to the bullseye. "Zhu Ziyu Lei" Volume 62: "If a person shoots an arrow, he expects to be in the middle of the red heart, and when he shoots it on the sticker, it can also be said to be a middle person.

" Tie " can also be used as a quantifier. Ming Xie Zhaozhe's "Five Miscellaneous Cu: The Third of Things": "Li uses ten coins to make ten stickers. He still suspects that the herbal medicine is bad. First, he takes two stickers to convince himself, and he can bring them in."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " bei " and " accounting ", the original meaning is pawn, that is, material money.
humanum_full_description:
從「貝」，「占」聲，本義為典押，即以物質錢。《說文新附》：「以物爲質也。从貝，占聲。」 《南史‧蔡廓傳》：「百姓楊元孫以婢采芝貼與同里黃權，約生子，酬乳哺直。」

　　「貼」可表示補償、補貼。《西游記》第35回：「快快的送將出來還我，多多貼些盤費，喜喜歡歡打發老孫起身，還饒了你這個老妖的狗命！」

　　「貼」也表示靠近。《水滸傳》第74回：「原來這壽張縣貼着梁山泊最近。」

　　「貼」還表示妥當、適當。宋梅堯臣〈次韻和長吉上人淮甸相遇〉：「文字皆妥貼，業術無傾攲。」

　　「貼」亦指黏附、張貼。唐溫庭筠〈菩薩蠻〉：「照花前後鏡，花面交相映。新貼繡羅襦，雙雙金鷓鴣。」

　　「貼」也指箭靶心。《朱子語類》卷六二：「如人射箭，期於中紅心，射在貼上，亦可謂中，終不若他射中紅心者。」

　　「貼」也可以用作量詞。明謝肇淛《五雜俎‧物部三》：「李以十錢易十貼，尚疑草藥性厲，先以二貼自服之，無恙，旦以攜入。」
humanum_short_description: 從「貝」，「占」聲，本義為典押，即以物質錢。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 占 indicates the sound; 貝 (money) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 占 [ zhàn ] to divine; to observe; to versify
①粘，把一種東西粘在另一種東西上：貼金。粘貼。剪貼。
②靠近，緊挨：貼近。貼切(密合、恰當、確切)。貼心。
③添補，補助：補貼。津貼。倒(dào)貼。貼息(用期票調換現款時付出利息)。
④同“帖”。
⑤傳統戲劇角色名：貼旦(次要的旦角。簡稱“貼”)。

貼る(はる): to stick, paste

從「 貝 」，「 占 」聲，本義為典押，即以物質錢。《說文新附》：「以物爲質也。从貝，占聲。」 《南史‧蔡廓傳》：「百姓楊元孫以婢采芝貼與同里黃權，約生子，酬乳哺直。」 「 貼 」可表示補償、補貼。《西游記》第35回：「快快的送將出來還我，多多貼些盤費，喜喜歡歡打發老孫起身，還饒了你這個老妖的狗命！」 「 貼 」也表示靠近。《水滸傳》第74回：「原來這壽張縣貼着梁山泊最近。」 「 貼 」還表示妥當、適當。宋梅堯臣〈次韻和長吉上人淮甸相遇〉：「文字皆妥貼，業術無傾攲。」 「 貼 」亦指黏附、張貼。唐溫庭筠〈菩薩蠻〉：「照花前後鏡，花面交相映。新貼繡羅襦，雙雙金鷓鴣。」 「 貼 」也指箭靶心。《朱子語類》卷六二：「如人射箭，期於中紅心，射在貼上，亦可謂中，終不若他射中紅心者。」 「 貼 」也可以用作量詞。明謝肇淛《五雜俎‧物部三》：「李以十錢易十貼，尚疑草藥性厲，先以二貼自服之，無恙，旦以攜入。」
From the sound of " bei" and " accounting", the original meaning is pawn, that is, material money. "Shuowen Xinfu": "The quality is also from the shells. From the shells, the sound is accounted." "The Southern History·Cai Kuo Biography": "The people Yang Yuansun uses the maidservant to pick up Zhizhi paste and Tongli Huangquan to have children and pay for breastfeeding. " " Paste" can mean compensation or subsidy. "Journey to the West" Chapter 35: "Hurry up and give it back to me, pay more money, I like to send the old grandson to get up, and spare you the old demon's life!" " Post" also means to be close. "Water Margin" Chapter 74: "It turns out that Liangshanpo is next to Shouzhang County." " Post" also means proper and appropriate. Song Mei Yaochen "Meeting of Ciyun and Master Changji Huaidian": "The words are all properly attached, and the karma is not overwhelming." " Paste" also refers to sticking or posting. Tang Wen Tingyun "Bodhisattva Man": "The front and back mirrors of the flowers reflect each other. The new embroidered Luo Yu, double gold partridges." " Paste" also refers to the bullseye. "Zhu Ziyu Lei" Volume 62: "If a person shoots an arrow, he expects to be in the middle of the red heart, and when he shoots it on the sticker, it can also be said to be a middle person. " Tie" can also be used as a quantifier. Ming Xie Zhaozhe's "Five Miscellaneous Cu: The Third of Things": "Li uses ten coins to make ten stickers. He still suspects that the herbal medicine is bad. First, he takes two stickers to convince himself, and he can bring them in."

tiē
见“贴”。

貼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tiē］
［《廣韻》他協切，入帖，透。］
“贴1”的繁体字。
(1)以物质钱；典押。
(2)补偿；补贴。
(3)指送与。
(4)靠近。
(5)喻专注。
(6)适合；妥当。
(7)引申为安穏、安定。
(8)黏附；张贴。
(9)以书或纸充当的夹子。
(10)指箭靶正中心的周围部分。
(11)谓贴出。
(12)即贴旦。
(13)副职。
(14)指辅佐，帮助。参见“貼防”。
(15)柬帖。
(16)量词。
(17)方言。拍打。
(18)方言。栽种。

貼字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　貼； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1207第05
【廣韻】【正韻】他協切【集韻】【韻會】托協切，?音帖。【說文】以物爲質也。　又【增韻】裨也，依附也，黏置也。　又【篇海】?貼，謂舒爽也。?音條。
